intro: Kakosmanthus cuneatus, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Kakosmanthus cuneatus is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
